mode: 4-dimension model expansion: NAICS 6-digit decomposition + supply chain adjacencies + external sources + AI beneficiaries
methodology: Systematic identification of 145 uncovered 6-digit NAICS sectors across 94 4-digit parents, plus supply chain adjacencies, failed startup opportunities, and AI beneficiary models

dimension_1_naics_decomposition.description: New models from uncovered 6-digit NAICS sectors not present in any cycle 7 model

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Independent Auto Repair Shop
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner auto repair shop (86K establishments, median age 58). Deploy AI diagnostics (OBD-II + computer vision), predictive maintenance scheduling, parts inventory optimization. NAICS 811111: 390K employees, $55K avg pay but $85-120K revenue per bay. 86K establishments = MOST fragmented repair sector. SBA 504 eligible.

models.name: Multi-Shop Auto Repair Rollup with AI Diagnostics
models.one_liner: Consolidate 10-20 independent auto repair shops into AI-native network. Centralized diagnostics, parts procurement, scheduling. Shops at 2-3x EBITDA ($200K-$500K each). EV transition creating massive retraining need — AI-augmented shops handle both ICE and EV. Maaco/Meineke franchise model proves multi-unit auto repair works.

models.name: Auto Repair Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start as diagnostics service for independent shops, compound into definitive repair pattern database. Every vehicle serviced adds to diagnostic accuracy. At scale: predict failures before they happen, optimize parts inventory across network. Mitchell/AllData incumbents are static databases — AI-native system learns from every repair.

models.name: Full-Service AI Landscaping Operations
models.one_liner: AI-native landscaping operations: automated route optimization, crew scheduling, property measurement via satellite/drone, instant quoting. NAICS 561730: 879K employees, 122K establishments = MOST fragmented service sector in US. $48K avg pay = low labor cost but massive workforce. Jevons: AI quoting makes landscaping accessible to 2-3x more properties.

models.name: Multi-Territory Landscaping Rollup with AI Operations
models.one_liner: Acquire 15-25 landscaping companies across a metro region, deploy AI route optimization + scheduling + satellite property measurement. Shops at 1.5-2.5x EBITDA ($100K-$300K each). BrightView ($2.7B) validates rollup model but at enterprise scale — no AI-native SMB rollup exists. 122K establishments = deepest acquisition pool of any service sector.

models.name: AI Operations Platform for Landscaping Companies
models.one_liner: SaaS+AI platform for 122K landscaping companies: satellite property measurement, instant quoting, route optimization, crew management, invoicing. Current tools (Jobber, ServiceTitan) are generic field service — no landscaping-specific AI. At 5K users: predict seasonal demand, optimize equipment utilization across customers.

models.name: Full-Service AI Wholesale Brokerage
models.one_liner: Replace wholesale trade brokers/agents with AI-native intermediation. NAICS 425120: 512K employees, 122K establishments, $126K avg pay (Baumol 1.73x). Classic middleman disruption — AI matches buyers to suppliers, handles negotiation, manages logistics. Identified in C9 bottom-up screen as LOW competitive density. $126K/employee cost structure AI can undercut by 70-80%.

models.name: Wholesale Trade Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start as AI wholesale brokerage, compound into definitive B2B trade flow intelligence platform. Every transaction reveals pricing patterns, demand cycles, supply chain relationships. At 10K transactions: predict commodity price movements, identify arbitrage. At 100K: become the Bloomberg Terminal of wholesale trade. 122K establishments = massive data collection surface.

models.name: Full-Service AI Medical Equipment Distribution
models.one_liner: AI-native medical equipment distribution replacing traditional sales reps. NAICS 423450: 308K employees, 34K establishments, $127K avg pay. Medical device distribution requires compliance tracking, reprocessing protocols, 510(k) awareness. AI handles product matching, compliance verification, reorder optimization. Regulatory complexity = moat.

models.name: AI-Native Industrial Machinery Distribution
models.one_liner: Replace aging industrial machinery distributors with AI-native matching platform. NAICS 423830: 340K employees, 37K establishments. Many distributors are retiring-owner businesses — Silver Tsunami applies to distribution same as manufacturing. AI matches manufacturer specs to buyer needs, handles quoting, predictive reorder.

models.name: AI-Matched B2B Wholesale Marketplace
models.one_liner: Network marketplace connecting wholesale buyers directly to manufacturers/distributors via AI matching. Eliminates layers of intermediation. NAICS 425120 alone has 122K establishments of brokers/agents. At critical mass: network effects make individual brokers unable to match breadth of connections.

models.name: Full-Service AI Property Management
models.one_liner: Replace property management companies with AI-native full-service operations. NAICS 531311+531312: 698K employees, 98K establishments. AI handles tenant screening, maintenance dispatch, rent collection, compliance, communication. RealPage concentrated at enterprise but 98K SMB managers unserved. Jevons: enable individual landlords (10M+ units) to self-manage with AI.

key_data.competitive_density: MODERATE — RealPage/Yardi at enterprise, gap at SMB/individual

models.name: Property Operations Intelligence (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start with AI property management for SMB landlords, compound into definitive rental market intelligence. Every property managed generates: maintenance patterns by building age/type, tenant payment behavior, seasonal demand, repair cost benchmarks. At 50K units: predict maintenance needs before failure. At 500K: become Zillow-level intelligence for operations.

models.name: AI Operations Platform for Property Managers
models.one_liner: Platform for 98K property management companies: AI tenant screening, predictive maintenance, automated rent collection, compliance tracking. AppFolio ($7B) validates market but limited AI. Gap: AI-native platform purpose-built for SMB managers (5-50 units).

models.name: Fair Housing AI Compliance for Property Managers
models.one_liner: Build AI compliance layer for Fair Housing Act, state/local tenant protection laws across 50 states + local jurisdictions. Every new tenant protection law increases platform value. Property managers face increasing litigation risk from AI screening tools — compliance platform prevents liability.

models.name: Full-Service AI Real Estate Appraisal
models.one_liner: AI-powered real estate appraisal replacing manual inspections with computer vision + comparable analysis. NAICS 531320: 30K appraisers, 14K establishments. Average age >55. Appraiser shortage creating 30-45 day delays. AI can do comps analysis in minutes, human reviews for 15 min. Full service at 50% of cost.

models.name: AI-Native RIA / Wealth Advisory for Mass Affluent
models.one_liner: Full-service AI wealth management for mass affluent ($100K-$1M AUM) underserved by human advisors. NAICS 523940: 496K employees, 85K establishments, $270K avg pay (Baumol 3.72x = HIGHEST stored energy). Jevons: at $50/month (vs $5K+/year human advisor), 10x more people access wealth management. WARNING: SATURATED competitive density (Wealthfront, Betterment, Schwab). Only viable with differentiated data moat or niche.

models.name: Securities Intermediation Intelligence (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: AI for miscellaneous financial intermediation — loan brokers, transfer agents, financial planners. NAICS 523910+523999: 69K employees, 17K establishments, $230K+ avg pay. Start as AI-powered intermediation service, compound into financial flow intelligence. MODERATE density — less saturated than core wealth management.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Beauty Salon Chain
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner beauty salons, deploy AI scheduling, inventory management, client personalization. NAICS 812112: 366K employees, est. 80K+ establishments. Low avg pay ($35K) but $200K+ revenue per chair. AI enables: predictive scheduling (reduce no-shows 30-40%), product recommendation, dynamic pricing.

models.name: AI Operations Platform for Beauty/Salon Industry
models.one_liner: Platform for beauty/salon industry: AI booking, client preference learning, inventory optimization, social media content generation. Fresha, Vagaro exist but limited AI. Gap: AI-native platform that actually generates social content and predicts trends.

models.name: Full-Service AI Commercial Equipment Repair
models.one_liner: AI-augmented commercial/industrial equipment repair: predictive maintenance, remote diagnostics, AR-guided repair for field techs. NAICS 811310: 236K employees. Equipment gets smarter (IoT sensors) but repair workforce aging. AI bridges: remote expert + on-site tech with AR guidance = 2x more repairs per tech per day.

models.name: Equipment Reliability Intelligence (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start with AI-augmented equipment repair, compound into definitive equipment failure pattern database. Every repair generates: failure mode, time-to-failure, parts consumed, environmental conditions. At 100K repairs: predict failures weeks before they happen. At 1M: become the predictive maintenance intelligence layer for industrial equipment.

models.name: AI-Native Video Production Studio
models.one_liner: Full-service video production at 80% lower cost using AI: script generation, storyboarding, AI-assisted editing, automated color grading, AI dubbing/localization. NAICS 512110: 206K employees, 25K establishments, $115K avg pay, DECLINING employment. Baumol cure in action. Jevons: 10x more businesses can afford professional video at AI-native cost. WARNING: tools layer crowded (Runway, Pika, Sora).

key_data.competitive_density: HIGH at tool layer, LOW at full-service

models.name: AI-Native PR/Communications Agency
models.one_liner: Full-service AI PR agency: media monitoring, press release drafting, journalist matching, crisis response, social listening. NAICS 541820: 66K employees, 15K establishments, $135K avg pay (Baumol 1.86x). AI can handle 80% of PR tasks (monitoring, drafting, distribution) with human review for strategy and relationships.

models.name: Full-Service AI Marketing Agency
models.one_liner: AI-native marketing agency replacing traditional consultancies. NAICS 541613: 323K employees, 89K establishments, $102K avg pay. AI handles: market research, competitor analysis, campaign strategy, content creation, performance tracking. Jevons: SMBs ($1K-5K/month) access agency-quality marketing at 10x lower cost. 89K establishments = highly fragmented.

models.name: Full-Service AI Advertising Operations
models.one_liner: AI-native advertising agency: creative generation, media buying optimization, performance analytics, A/B testing at scale. NAICS 541810: 223K employees, 38K establishments, $123K avg pay. WPP/Omnicom at enterprise — gap at SMB where AI can deliver enterprise-quality creative at SMB prices.

models.name: AI Talent Agent / Artist Management Platform
models.one_liner: AI-native talent management for independent creators, athletes, entertainers. NAICS 711410: 30K employees, 7K establishments, $133K avg pay. AI handles: contract analysis, brand deal matching, scheduling, social media optimization, revenue tracking. Coasean: creators who needed a 15-person agency team now need AI + 1 human.

models.name: Full-Service AI Creative Operations for Independent Artists
models.one_liner: AI operations layer for independent artists/writers/performers. NAICS 711510: 60K employees, 39K establishments = HIGHLY fragmented gig economy. AI handles: invoicing, contract review, IP management, royalty tracking, marketing. Jevons: at $49/month vs $5K/month traditional management, 10x more artists access professional operations.

models.name: Freight Arrangement Intelligence (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: AI freight brokerage starting as matching service, compounding into definitive freight intelligence. NAICS 488510: 271K employees, 24K establishments. WARNING: Convoy $900M failure at 100-1000x capital. Differential: don't try to be Uber-for-freight. Focus on specialized freight intelligence (cold chain, hazmat, oversized) where domain data creates moat.

key_data.competitive_density: HIGH — Convoy failed, but Flexport $8B+, Echo $2B+. Niche specialized freight = MODERATE

models.name: AI-Native Local Specialized Freight
models.one_liner: AI-managed local specialized freight (not-for-hire exemption). NAICS 484220: 225K employees, 31K establishments. Local specialized freight (construction materials, refrigerated, flatbed) is fragmented and aging. AI handles: route optimization, load matching, regulatory compliance, predictive maintenance. Different from Convoy (long-haul general) — local specialized has relationship moats.

models.name: AI Warehouse Operations Platform
models.one_liner: AI operations platform for warehousing. NAICS 493110: 1.73M employees, 17K establishments. AI handles: inventory optimization, pick path optimization, demand forecasting, workforce scheduling. Robotics integration for automated picking. Amazon sets the bar but 17K independent warehouses lack these capabilities. $51K avg pay — massive labor cost to optimize.

models.name: AI-Native Pharmaceutical Distribution Intelligence
models.one_liner: AI layer for pharmaceutical distribution: drug interaction checking, formulary optimization, 340B compliance, inventory management for independent pharmacies. NAICS 424210: 259K employees, 23K establishments, $162K avg pay. WARNING: McKesson/AmerisourceBergen/Cardinal Health = concentrated at top, but 23K establishments suggests fragmented tail serving independent pharmacies.

key_data.competitive_density: CONCENTRATED at top 3 (92% share), but MODERATE at independent pharmacy distribution tail

models.name: AI-Native Electrical Distribution
models.one_liner: AI wholesale distribution for electrical apparatus and supplies. NAICS 423610: 195K employees, 19K establishments, $102K avg pay. Electrification trend (EV chargers, solar, battery storage) creating new product complexity that aging distributors struggle with. AI handles: product specification matching, code compliance, inventory optimization.

models.name: AI Chemical Distribution with Safety Intelligence
models.one_liner: AI-native chemical distribution: SDS management, compatibility checking, regulatory compliance (EPA, OSHA, DOT), inventory optimization. NAICS 424690: 121K employees, 14K establishments, $109K avg pay. Chemical distribution requires extensive safety documentation — AI automates compliance while human handles physical logistics. Regulatory complexity = moat.

models.name: AI-Augmented New Car Dealership Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations layer for car dealerships: lead scoring, inventory optimization, trade-in valuation, F&I product recommendation, service scheduling. NAICS 441110: 1.1M employees, 21K dealerships. EV transition creating massive retraining/retooling need. Dealerships are franchise-protected (state dealer laws) but operationally inefficient. CDK Global ($6B) shows platform market exists but is pre-AI.

models.name: AI-Native Private Household Services Platform
models.one_liner: AI matchmaking and operations for private household employers (nannies, housekeepers, private chefs, estate managers). NAICS 814110: 207K employees, 198K establishments (near 1:1 ratio = each employer is an 'establishment'). Declining employment (-2.5%) but growing demand — gap is matching + compliance (payroll tax, I-9). Care.com ($500M) acquired but limited AI.

models.name: AI Hospital Operations Intelligence
models.one_liner: AI operations layer for hospitals: patient flow optimization, OR scheduling, staffing prediction, supply chain management. NAICS 622110: 4.9M employees, 10.8K establishments, $81K avg pay. $394B total wages = MASSIVE addressable labor cost. Hospitals concentrated at top but operationally similar — platform sells to all. Epic/Cerner are EHR, not operations AI.

models.name: Hospital Operations Intelligence (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start with OR scheduling/patient flow optimization for independent hospitals, compound into definitive hospital operations benchmark database. Every hospital generates: procedure duration distributions, staffing ratios vs outcomes, supply utilization patterns. At 100 hospitals: predict optimal staffing levels. At 500: become the definitive hospital operations intelligence layer.

models.name: AI-Native Medical Laboratory Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for medical/diagnostic laboratories. NAICS 621511: 231K employees. AI handles: test result interpretation assistance, quality control automation, sample routing optimization, billing/coding. Lab technician shortage (ASCP reports 20%+ vacancy rates) makes AI augmentation critical. Quest/LabCorp at enterprise but thousands of independent hospital and reference labs.

models.name: AI-Native Professional Training Delivery
models.one_liner: AI-native professional training: personalized learning paths, automated assessment, AI tutoring, simulation-based training. NAICS 611430: 54K employees. Baumol cure in education — instructor costs rising but AI can deliver personalized training at 10x lower cost. Jevons: 5x more workers access professional development at AI-native pricing.

models.name: AI Educational Support Services
models.one_liner: AI-powered educational support: tutoring, test prep, academic advising, learning disability screening. NAICS 611710: 204K employees. AI tutoring can be 24/7, personalized, and 10x cheaper than human tutoring ($15/hour AI vs $60-150/hour human). Khanmigo exists but limited. Jevons: every student gets personal tutor.

models.name: AI-Native Business Association Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for business/trade associations: member engagement, event management, advocacy tracking, research/reporting. NAICS 813910: 117K employees, 21K establishments. Associations are classic Baumol — membership dues rise with economy but operations haven't improved. AI handles: member communication, research briefs, regulatory monitoring.

models.name: AI Operations Platform for Self-Storage
models.one_liner: AI operations for self-storage facilities: dynamic pricing, demand forecasting, automated move-in/move-out, security monitoring, marketing optimization. NAICS 531130: 59K employees, 18K establishments. Public Storage/Extra Space dominate REITs but thousands of independent operators. Storeganise and similar exist but pre-AI.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Commercial HVAC/Mechanical Repair
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner commercial/industrial repair shops. Deploy AI diagnostics, predictive maintenance, remote monitoring. Physical assets (tools, test equipment, customer contracts) create convergence resistance. NAICS 811310: 236K employees. Data center cooling demand creating new growth in commercial HVAC repair.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Electronic Equipment Repair
models.one_liner: Acquire electronic/precision equipment repair businesses (oscilloscopes, medical devices, industrial controls). NAICS 811210: 106K employees. Retiring technicians with specialized knowledge. AI-assisted diagnostics + AR-guided repair extends capability of junior techs. Right-to-repair legislation expanding addressable market.

models.name: AI Operations for Petroleum Distribution
models.one_liner: AI operations for petroleum product wholesalers: demand forecasting, route optimization, regulatory compliance (EPA underground tank regs), hedging recommendations. NAICS 424720: 67K employees, 6K establishments, $117K avg pay. Declining long-term due to EV transition but still $50B+ market.

models.name: AI Grid Operations for Electric Utilities
models.one_liner: AI operations platform for electric power distribution. NAICS 221122: 224K employees, $128K avg pay. Grid modernization (DER integration, EV charging, solar/storage) creating massive complexity that manual operations can't handle. AI handles: load forecasting, outage prediction, DER optimization, rate design. Regulated utility = slow but guaranteed adoption.

models.name: AI Pipeline/Gas Distribution Operations
models.one_liner: AI for natural gas distribution: leak detection, pipeline integrity management, demand forecasting, regulatory compliance (PHMSA). NAICS 221210+486210: 147K employees. Methane reduction mandates (EPA Quad Ob) creating compliance urgency. AI leak detection (satellite + sensor fusion) can reduce methane emissions and compliance costs simultaneously.

models.name: AI Operations for Independent Grocery
models.one_liner: AI operations for independent grocery stores: demand forecasting, dynamic pricing, waste reduction, automated ordering, planogram optimization. NAICS 445110: 2.6M employees, $48K avg pay. Kroger/Walmart dominate but thousands of independent and ethnic grocers underserved by enterprise tech. Spoilage reduction alone can improve margins 2-3 percentage points.

models.name: AI-Native Publishing Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for periodical and niche publishers: content generation assistance, ad sales optimization, subscription analytics, audience segmentation. NAICS 513120+513199: 117K employees, 15K establishments, DECLINING employment. Baumol cure: editorial costs rising but AI can handle research, drafting, fact-checking. Full-service replaces 3-person editorial team.

models.name: AI Operations for Heavy/Highway Construction
models.one_liner: AI operations for highway/power line construction: project scheduling, equipment utilization, compliance tracking, progress monitoring (drone/satellite). NAICS 237310+237130: 584K employees. Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act ($1.2T) creating demand surge that existing workforce can't meet. AI extends each worker's productivity.

models.name: AI-Native Hotel Operations for Independent Properties
models.one_liner: Full-service AI hotel management for independent hotels. NAICS 721110: 1.5M employees, est. 55K properties. AI handles: dynamic pricing, guest communication, maintenance scheduling, housekeeping optimization, revenue management. Marriott/Hilton have enterprise tech — independent hotels (40% of market) lack it. $500-2K/month replaces $50K+/year revenue manager.

models.name: Hospitality Revenue Intelligence (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start with AI revenue management for independent hotels, compound into definitive hospitality intelligence. Every property generates: pricing sensitivity curves, demand patterns, competitive set dynamics, seasonal coefficients. At 1K properties: predict citywide demand 30 days out. At 10K: become the STR of AI-native hospitality data.

models.name: AI-Dispatched Motor Vehicle Towing Network
models.one_liner: AI dispatch marketplace for towing services. NAICS 488410: 74K employees, 11K establishments. Towing is hyper-local and fragmented. AI handles: automated dispatch (GPS-based closest truck), dynamic pricing, insurance/roadside integration. AAA dispatches 32M calls/year through manual dispatch. Honk/Swoop exist but neither dominant.

models.name: AI-Native Local Courier/Delivery Operations
models.one_liner: AI-native local courier/delivery: route optimization, demand prediction, dynamic pricing, fleet management. NAICS 492210: 177K employees, 9K establishments. Same-day delivery demand growing 20%+ annually. AI handles route optimization (30-40% fuel savings) + predictive demand staffing. Different from DoorDash (food) — B2B local delivery (medical samples, legal docs, parts).

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Specialty Trade Construction
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner specialty trade contractors (waterproofing, excavation, wrecking, scaffolding). NAICS 2389: 767K employees across 4 sub-sectors. Same Silver Tsunami affecting manufacturing — trade contractors aging with no succession plan. AI assists: estimating, project scheduling, safety compliance, equipment management.

models.name: AI Network Operations for Regional Telecoms
models.one_liner: AI network operations for wired/wireless telecoms. NAICS 517111+517810: 513K employees. AI handles: network optimization, predictive maintenance, customer churn prediction, capacity planning. AT&T/Verizon at enterprise but 1,300+ regional ISPs and CLECs underserved. 5G/fiber buildout creating new complexity.

models.name: AI Process Optimization for Refineries
models.one_liner: AI process optimization for petroleum refineries: yield optimization, predictive maintenance, emissions monitoring, blending optimization. NAICS 324110: 62K employees, 659 establishments, $171K avg pay. Small number of large facilities but each refinery spends $50-200M/year on operations. AI yield improvement of 1% = $10-30M/year per refinery.

models.name: AI Platform for Furniture/Home Furnishings Retail
models.one_liner: AI for furniture/home retailers: AR room visualization, inventory optimization, customer preference learning, delivery route optimization. NAICS 449210: 415K employees, est. 30K establishments. Wayfair ($12B) at online but physical furniture retail (70% of sales) still analog. AI bridges online visualization with in-store experience.

models.name: AI-Augmented Semiconductor Manufacturing Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for semiconductor fabs: yield optimization, defect detection, process control, predictive maintenance. NAICS 334413: 204K employees, 2.4K establishments, $201K avg pay. CHIPS Act ($52B) creating massive new fab construction. Each fab spends $1B+/year on operations. AI yield improvement of 0.5% = $50-100M/year per fab.

models.name: AI Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Process Optimization
models.one_liner: AI for pharmaceutical manufacturing: batch optimization, deviation management, process analytical technology (PAT), regulatory documentation (FDA 21 CFR Part 11). NAICS 325412: 228K employees, 4.7K establishments, $137K avg pay. FDA compliance documentation is 40-60% of pharma manufacturing cost — AI can reduce this while improving compliance.

models.name: Heavy Civil Construction Rollup with AI Project Management
models.one_liner: Consolidate 5-10 heavy civil contractors into AI-managed construction platform. NAICS 237: 1.1M employees across highway, power, and specialty construction. Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act creating $550B in new federal spending. Aging owners + massive backlog + AI project management = acquisition opportunity. SBA 504 eligible for equipment-heavy acquisitions.

models.name: AI-Native Commercial Leasing Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for nonresidential building lessors: tenant matching, lease optimization, maintenance scheduling, utility analysis, market comps. NAICS 531120: 157K employees, 27K establishments. Commercial real estate in turmoil (office vacancy 20%+, conversion to other uses). AI helps: adaptive reuse analysis, tenant credit scoring, operating cost optimization.

models.name: AI Platform for Manufacturing Grant/Incentive Capture
models.one_liner: AI platform matching manufacturers to federal/state grants and incentives: CHIPS Act, IRA, IIJA, state tax credits, workforce training grants. 50-state + federal = 5,000+ programs. Every new program increases platform value. No manufacturer has capacity to track all programs — AI monitors, matches, and assists applications. Regulatory moat: compliance complexity.

models.name: Acquire Distressed Media/Publishing Properties
models.one_liner: Acquire distressed media properties (local news, trade publications, niche content) at 1-2x EBITDA, operate with AI-native cost structure. NAICS 512110+513120+513199: declining employment, massive PE write-downs. AI handles: content generation, ad sales, audience analysis. Revenue: existing subscriber base + AI-enabled content expansion. Vice, BuzzFeed bankruptcies prove distress; niche/local content still has value.

models.name: AI Analytics for Sports Teams/Organizations
models.one_liner: AI analytics for sports organizations: player performance prediction, injury prevention, fan engagement, ticket pricing, sponsorship valuation. NAICS 711211: 109K employees, 3.5K establishments, $266K avg pay. MLB/NFL/NBA at cutting edge but minor leagues, college sports, international leagues underserved. Jevons: AI analytics accessible to every high school team.

models.name: AI Operations for Regional Airlines/Charter
models.one_liner: AI operations for regional/charter airlines: route optimization, crew scheduling, maintenance prediction, fuel optimization, revenue management. NAICS 481111+481211: 521K employees. Major airlines have AI teams but 200+ regional/charter operators lack capabilities. Each 1% fuel savings = $100K-1M/year per aircraft.

models.name: AI Operations for Grantmaking Foundations
models.one_liner: AI for grantmaking organizations: grant application review, impact measurement, portfolio analysis, compliance monitoring. NAICS 813211: 77K employees, est. 12K foundations. Foundations review 10-50x more applications than they fund — AI can pre-screen and rank. Impact measurement still manual — AI enables continuous tracking.

models.name: AI Operations for Elder Care/Disability Services
models.one_liner: AI operations for elder/disability services. NAICS 624120: 2.23M employees, 925K establishments = MOST FRAGMENTED sector in entire economy. $26K avg pay = lowest-wage major sector. Demographic demand (65+ population growing 3%/year) vs declining real wages = Baumol cure prime target. AI handles: care coordination, medication reminders, fall detection, family communication, Medicaid billing.

models.name: Elder Care Services Rollup with AI Operations
models.one_liner: Consolidate 20-50 elder care agencies into AI-managed network. 925K establishments = deepest acquisition pool of any sector. Agencies at 1-2x revenue ($100K-$500K each). AI enables: centralized scheduling, quality monitoring, predictive staffing, family communication. Medicaid compliance across states = regulatory moat. 65+ population growth = structural demand guarantee.

models.name: Elder Care Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding)
models.one_liner: Start with AI elder care coordination, compound into definitive aging population care intelligence. Every client generates: health trajectory patterns, medication interaction data, caregiver effectiveness metrics, cost-of-care benchmarks. At 10K clients: predict health crises before they happen. At 100K: become the definitive elder care data layer for insurers, hospitals, and policymakers.

models.name: Elder Care AI Compliance Platform (Multi-State Medicaid)
models.one_liner: Compliance platform for elder care: 50-state Medicaid billing, EVV (Electronic Visit Verification) requirements, licensure tracking, HIPAA compliance, state-specific care plan documentation. 21st Century Cures Act mandated EVV — every state implemented differently. Compliance complexity = permanent moat. Each new regulation increases platform value.

models.name: AI Operations Platform for Home/Elder Care Agencies
models.one_liner: SaaS+AI platform for 925K elder care agencies: caregiver scheduling, EVV compliance, care plan management, family portal, Medicaid billing. Current tools (ClearCare, Axxess) are pre-AI. Gap: AI-native platform that predicts staffing needs, automates compliance, and coordinates across providers.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Auto Body/Collision Repair
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner auto body shops. Deploy AI estimating (photo-to-estimate), ADAS calibration capabilities, DRP management. ADAS-equipped vehicles require specialized calibration after collision — many shops can't do this. AI + ADAS calibration capability = competitive moat. Caliber/Service King at scale but thousands of independents.

models.name: AI Environmental Consulting/Compliance
models.one_liner: AI-native environmental consulting: emissions monitoring, NEPA compliance documentation, ESG reporting, permit management. Regulatory complexity increasing exponentially (EPA methane rules, SEC climate disclosure, state GHG programs). AI handles: document generation, data collection, regulatory tracking. Each new regulation = more revenue + deeper moat.

models.name: AI-Native Veterinary Lab/Diagnostics Service
models.one_liner: AI-powered veterinary diagnostics: image analysis (radiology, cytology, dermatology), lab result interpretation, treatment recommendation. NAICS 541940: part of vet services. IDEXX dominates lab equipment ($14B) but interpretation is still manual. AI can provide specialist-level diagnostic interpretation to general practitioners at 10x lower cost. Jevons: rural/small practices access specialist diagnostics.

models.name: AI-Native Contract Research/R&D Services
models.one_liner: AI-augmented contract R&D services: literature review, experiment design, data analysis, patent landscape analysis, regulatory pathway mapping. NAICS 541714+541715: 830K employees, 47K establishments, $180K+ avg pay. AI can handle 60-70% of early-stage research tasks (lit review, data analysis, hypothesis generation). Jevons: small biotechs access Fortune 500-level R&D capabilities.

dimension_2_supply_chain_adjacencies.description: Models generated from BEA Input-Output supply chain analysis — businesses that emerge from second-order disruption propagation
dimension_2_supply_chain_adjacencies.methodology: If professional services / accounting / legal costs collapse 50-80%, downstream industries that consumed those services now have surplus budget. If manufacturing modernizes, upstream suppliers and downstream distributors must adapt.

models.name: AI Banking Infrastructure for Community Banks
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Banks (NAICS 522110, 1.39M employees) are DOWNSTREAM consumers of legal, accounting, and compliance services. As AI collapses those input costs, community banks gain margin — but need AI operations themselves. Platform for 4,000+ community banks: AI underwriting, compliance monitoring, customer service, fraud detection. Jack Henry ($13B) is pre-AI core banking.

models.name: AI Infrastructure for Independent Insurance Agencies
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Insurance agencies (NAICS 524210, 971K employees, 158K establishments) consume accounting, legal, compliance services upstream. As those costs fall, margin improves — but agencies need AI for quoting, claims, customer service. Platform for 158K independent agencies. Applied Epic/Vertafore are pre-AI. Coasean: AI enables 1-2 person agencies to compete with 50-person shops.

models.name: AI Operations for Engineering Services Firms
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Engineering services (NAICS 541330, 1.14M employees, 96K establishments) sits downstream of manufacturing modernization — as manufacturing adopts AI, engineering must also adapt. AI handles: CAD review, code compliance checking, structural analysis, project management, RFP response generation. $117K avg pay = significant Baumol energy. Infrastructure bill creating demand surge.

models.name: AI Supply Chain Platform for Modernized Manufacturers
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As manufacturing shops modernize (our top models), their supply chain must adapt. AI platform for industrial distributors: predictive reordering based on manufacturer production schedules, quality tracking across suppliers, just-in-time optimization. Connects upgraded manufacturers to upgraded suppliers.

models.name: AI Legal Operations for Mid-Market Companies
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Law firms (NAICS 541110, 1.08M employees, 187K establishments, $129K avg pay) serve every business in the economy. As AI collapses legal cost 50-80%, full-service AI legal ops replaces outside counsel for mid-market companies. Contract review, compliance monitoring, litigation analytics, regulatory tracking. Harvey, CoCounsel at enterprise — gap at $1K-10K/month mid-market.

models.name: AI Food Distribution Intelligence for Modernized Producers
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As specialty food producers modernize (our AM-FOOD models), distribution becomes the bottleneck. AI food distribution: demand forecasting, spoilage prediction, cold chain optimization, retailer matching. NAICS 424490+424410: 500K employees. Connects AI-modernized food producers to distributors to retailers. Data from production + distribution + retail = compound intelligence.

models.name: AI Workforce Retraining for Disrupted Industries
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As AI disrupts professional services, workers need retraining. AI-native reskilling platform for displaced accountants, paralegals, administrative staff. Personalized learning paths, competency assessment, job matching. NAICS 611430+611710: 258K employees. Government workforce development funds ($3B+ annually) available. Structural demand: every Baumol cure creates retraining demand.

models.name: AI IT Equipment Lifecycle Management
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As businesses deploy more AI, IT equipment needs change dramatically (GPU servers, edge devices, networking). AI lifecycle management: procurement optimization, refresh planning, capacity forecasting, vendor negotiation. NAICS 423430: 235K employees, 18K establishments. CDW ($22B) is pre-AI procurement — gap for AI-native equipment lifecycle intelligence.

models.name: AI Operations for Oilfield Services
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Oil/gas extraction drives massive service industry downstream. NAICS 213112: 220K employees, 14K establishments, $107K avg pay. AI handles: drilling optimization, reservoir modeling, predictive maintenance, safety compliance. Halliburton/SLB at enterprise but thousands of independent service companies lack AI capabilities.

models.name: AI Real Estate Transaction Intelligence
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Real estate agents/brokers (NAICS 531210, 356K employees, 163K establishments) consume legal, title, and inspection services upstream. As those costs fall, transaction costs fall — enabling more transactions. AI transaction platform: automated CMA, contract generation, title review, closing coordination. Jevons: lower transaction costs = more transactions.

models.name: AI Administrative Operations for Higher Education
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Universities (NAICS 611310, 1.26M employees) are downstream consumers of accounting, legal, IT, and administrative services. AI operations for universities: admissions processing, financial aid optimization, course scheduling, research administration, donor management. Workday/Ellucian are pre-AI ERP — gap for AI-native university operations.

models.name: AI Parts Intelligence for Auto Repair Modernization
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As auto repair shops modernize (our AM-AUTO models), parts procurement becomes data-rich. AI parts intelligence: predictive reordering, cross-reference optimization, counterfeit detection, pricing comparison. Every repair generates parts consumption data. At scale: predict parts demand by vehicle age/model/region weeks in advance.

models.name: AI Medical Device Lifecycle for Healthcare AI Adoption
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As healthcare practices adopt AI (our HC models), they need AI-compatible medical devices and integration. AI medical device lifecycle: procurement, integration with AI diagnostic systems, regulatory compliance (510(k)), maintenance prediction. FDA SaMD (Software as Medical Device) framework creates compliance moat.

models.name: AI Construction Materials Distribution
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Infrastructure bill + construction modernization drives materials demand. AI materials distribution: demand forecasting from permit data, price optimization, logistics coordination, substitution recommendation. NAICS 423310+444180: 365K employees. Connects AI-modernized contractors to optimized supply chain.

models.name: AI Cybersecurity Operations for SMBs
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As every business deploys AI, cybersecurity becomes critical. AI-native managed security for SMBs: threat detection, compliance monitoring (SOC2, HIPAA, PCI), incident response, vulnerability management. NAICS 541512: 1.14M employees but enterprise-focused. Gap: AI-native security operations at $500-2K/month for SMBs. SEC cyber disclosure rules + state privacy laws = regulatory tailwind.

models.name: AI Workforce Transition Services
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As staffing industry declines (NAICS 5613, -7.6% employment), workers need transition services. AI workforce transition: skills assessment, reskilling pathways, job matching, career coaching. Different from staffing (placing bodies) — transition services (upskilling people). Government WIOA funding ($3B+/year) available. Every AI disruption cycle creates more demand.

models.name: AI Energy Services for Electrification Transition
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Electrification (EV, heat pumps, solar) transforms both power distribution and power line construction. AI energy services: load analysis for EV charger placement, DER optimization, interconnection queue management, rate design analysis. Every utility needs this but internal teams understaffed. IRA incentives creating demand surge.

models.name: AI Operations for State/Local Government Services
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Government is the largest downstream consumer of professional services. As AI collapses those costs, government operations must also modernize. AI for state/local government: permit processing, constituent services, records management, budget analysis. 12-24 month procurement cycles but DOGE-driven modernization pressure creating urgency. Tyler Technologies ($1.8B) is incumbent but pre-AI.

dimension_3_external_sources.description: Models generated from external source analysis: failed startups, YC batches, BizBuySell patterns, market failure analysis
dimension_3_external_sources.note: Awaiting external research agent results — models below constructed from known market intelligence

models.name: AI-Native Local News/Content Revival
models.one_liner: DEAD BUSINESS REVIVAL: Local newspapers/news sites are dying (2,900+ closures since 2005). Acquire at distressed pricing (1-2x revenue), operate with AI-native editorial + AI ad sales. Content generation cost drops 80%, ad targeting improves 3-5x. Local news has unique value (zoning, school boards, police reports) that AI-only content can't replicate. Combine local reporters + AI amplification.

models.name: AI-Native Travel Advisory Service Revival
models.one_liner: DEAD BUSINESS REVIVAL: Traditional travel agencies killed by Expedia/Booking. But complex travel (group, luxury, multi-destination, corporate) still needs human judgment. AI-native travel advisory: AI handles research/booking/logistics, human handles relationship/preferences/problem-solving. At $99/trip (vs $500+ traditional agent), Jevons: 5x more travelers use advisory services.

models.name: AI-Native Photo/Video Post-Production Service
models.one_liner: DEAD BUSINESS REVIVAL: Photo labs died with digital. But demand for professional post-production (color grading, retouching, compositing) surging with social media/e-commerce. AI handles 90% of post-production (auto color, background removal, upscaling). Full-service at $5-20/image vs $50-200 traditional. Jevons: every e-commerce seller gets professional product photos.

models.name: AI Agent Operations Platform for Service Businesses
models.one_liner: YC-INSPIRED: Every service business (law, accounting, consulting, real estate) needs AI agents but can't build them. Platform providing pre-built, compliant AI agents for specific service verticals. Different from Zapier/Make (workflow automation) — these are full agents that handle client communication, research, document preparation. Vertical-specific compliance built in.

models.name: AI Recruiting for Blue-Collar/Trades Workers
models.one_liner: YC-INSPIRED: Most AI recruiting targets white-collar/tech. Blue-collar/trades recruiting is different: skills verification, certification tracking, availability scheduling, geographic matching. 7.4M unfilled trade jobs (NAHB). AI handles: credential verification, skills matching, schedule optimization. LinkedIn/Indeed don't serve this market well.

models.name: AI Compliance-as-a-Service for Regulated Industries
models.one_liner: YC-INSPIRED: Every regulated industry needs compliance. AI compliance-as-a-service: continuous monitoring, automated reporting, regulatory change tracking, audit preparation. Multi-sector (healthcare, finance, environmental, food safety). Each new regulation permanently increases value. Different from point solutions — horizontal compliance layer that works across industries.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Plumbing/HVAC Company
models.one_liner: BIZBUYSELL: Plumbing/HVAC companies actively listed for sale ($300K-$2M). Owner age 55+ with no succession plan. Deploy AI: scheduling optimization, predictive maintenance for service contracts, dynamic pricing, automated dispatching. Physical assets (trucks, tools, licenses) = convergence resistance. Data center cooling demand creating new HVAC growth.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Commercial Cleaning Company
models.one_liner: BIZBUYSELL: Janitorial/cleaning companies actively listed ($100K-$500K). Deploy AI: route optimization, quality verification (computer vision), dynamic scheduling, supply ordering. NAICS 561720: 1.06M employees, 97K establishments. Low-margin but high-volume. AI can improve margins 5-10 percentage points through efficiency.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Pest Control Company
models.one_liner: BIZBUYSELL: Pest control companies listed ($200K-$1M). Deploy AI: route optimization, predictive treatment scheduling, automated customer communication, IoT monitoring. Rentokil ($20B) and Terminix at scale but 25K+ independent operators. License requirements = moat. Climate change extending pest seasons = demand growth.

models.name: Specialized Freight Intelligence (Post-Convoy Lesson)
models.one_liner: FAILURE STUDY: Convoy ($900M failure) tried to be Uber-for-freight in general trucking — marketplace without differentiation. Lesson: general freight matching is commoditized. Opportunity: SPECIALIZED freight intelligence (cold chain, hazmat, oversized, high-value) where domain expertise creates data moat. Focus on 1-2 specialized segments, not general marketplace.

models.name: AI SMB Financial Operations (Post-Bench, Post-Pilot Lesson)
models.one_liner: FAILURE STUDY: Bench ($113M), Pilot ($200M+), Decimal — all failed at human-heavy bookkeeping model. Lesson: full-service bookkeeping with 80% human labor doesn't scale. Opportunity: AI-native model where AI does 95% of work, human reviews 5%. At $0.05/month inference vs $150+/hour human bookkeeper. 35K Bench orphan customers immediately available. This IS our DC-FIN-01 but validated by 3 independent failures.

models.name: AI-Augmented Real Estate Brokerage
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Traditional real estate agents enhanced (not replaced) by AI: automated CMA generation, listing description writing, lead scoring, showing scheduling, contract review. NAICS 531210: 356K employees, 163K establishments. Agent stays for relationship/negotiation but AI handles 70% of research/admin. Agent productivity 2-3x higher = more deals per agent.

models.name: AI-Enhanced Dental Practice Operations
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Dental practices enhanced by AI: radiograph interpretation, treatment planning, insurance verification, patient communication. Dentist stays for procedures but AI handles 60% of diagnostic/admin. Independent practices (120K+) compete better against PE rollups by having AI cost structure without PE debt.

models.name: AI-Enhanced Small Farm Operations
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Small/specialty farms (not commodity row crop) enhanced by AI: pest/disease detection via phone camera, irrigation optimization, market price monitoring, harvest timing, regulatory compliance (organic/GAP). Davis CA location = direct access to UC Davis ag AI research and Central Valley growers. Jevons: AI makes precision agriculture accessible to 50-acre farms, not just 5000-acre operations.

dimension_4_ai_beneficiaries.description: Traditional businesses that don't get REPLACED by AI but THRIVE with AI adoption — the 'AI beneficiary' lens
dimension_4_ai_beneficiaries.key_insight: Most research focuses on AI replacing businesses. But many traditional businesses become 2-5x more profitable when they adopt AI tools. These are the 'rising tide' opportunities — building the tools/services that help traditional businesses capture AI benefits.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Accounting Practice (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Don't sell accounting software — BE an accounting firm that uses AI internally. New-entrant practice using AI for 90% of work: tax prep, bookkeeping, audit prep, payroll. 1 CPA + AI handles workload of 10-person traditional firm. CA AB 1175 (effective Jan 2027) lowers CPA experience requirements. Price at 40% of traditional firms. Operate nationally via virtual model.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Law Practice (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native law firm where 1 attorney + AI handles workload of 5-person traditional firm. Focus on high-volume practice areas: immigration, business formation, estate planning, IP filing. AI handles: research, drafting, document review, client communication. Attorney focuses on judgment calls and court appearances. Price at 50% of traditional firms.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Insurance Agency (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native insurance agency where 1 agent + AI handles portfolio of 500+ clients (vs traditional 150-200). AI handles: quoting, policy comparison, renewal management, claims assistance, regulatory compliance. Agent focuses on relationships and complex cases. Each additional client has near-zero marginal cost. 158K existing agencies are potential acquisition targets.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Veterinary Practice (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native veterinary practice where AI handles diagnostics (radiograph interpretation, lab analysis), treatment protocols, client communication, inventory management. DVM focuses on procedures and complex cases. Throughput 2-3x traditional practice. Mars/IDEXX dominate corporate vet, but independent practices (75%+ of market) can compete with AI augmentation.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Architecture Firm (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native architecture firm. AI handles: code compliance checking, energy modeling, rendering, construction document generation, specification writing. Architect focuses on design and client relationships. 1 architect + AI produces work of 5-person traditional firm. Infrastructure demand + housing shortage = structural demand growth.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Engineering Consulting (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native engineering consulting firm. AI handles: structural calculations, code checking, report generation, CAD review, RFP response. Engineer PE stamp still required (moat). 1 PE + AI handles projects that required 5-person team. Infrastructure bill creating demand surge. Price at 40% of traditional engineering firms.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Land Surveying Practice
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native surveying practice using drone/LiDAR + AI processing. Traditional survey takes 2-3 days fieldwork + 1 week office processing. AI-native: 4-hour drone flight + same-day AI processing. PLS stamp still required (moat). Surveyor shortage (avg age 59, retiring faster than graduating). Price at 50% of traditional. Infrastructure bill creating demand surge.

models.name: AI-Native Tax Preparation Service
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native tax preparation for small businesses and individuals with complex situations (rental income, K-1s, multi-state). AI handles: data extraction, form preparation, optimization analysis, audit risk assessment. EA/CPA reviews and signs. TurboTax for simple returns, expensive CPAs for complex — gap in middle at $199-499 for AI-prepared + human-reviewed complex returns.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Construction Management
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native construction management firm. AI handles: scheduling, cost estimation, RFI processing, change order analysis, progress monitoring (drone/photo). PM focuses on relationships and problem-solving. 1 PM + AI manages projects that required 4-person team. Infrastructure bill + housing shortage = structural demand. Price competitively vs 20-person CM firms.

models.name: AI-Augmented Home/Building Inspection Service
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-augmented building inspection: computer vision for defect detection, thermal imaging analysis, automated report generation, code compliance checking. Inspector still goes on-site but AI analyzes photos, generates report, flags issues. Throughput 3x (4 inspections/day vs 1-2). Price at 70% of traditional. Inspector licensing = moat.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Physical Therapy Practice
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-augmented PT practice. AI handles: exercise program generation, progress tracking (computer vision for range-of-motion measurement), billing/coding, patient communication, outcome prediction. PT focuses on manual therapy and complex cases. Throughput 2x with AI-guided home exercise programs monitored remotely. Jevons: AI monitoring enables treating 3x more patients.

models.name: AI-Enhanced Independent Pharmacy Operations
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Independent pharmacies (21K+) competing against CVS/Walgreens with AI: drug interaction checking, formulary optimization, adherence prediction, clinical services documentation, PBM contract analysis. Pharmacist license = moat. PBM reform legislation (FTC actions) creating window for independent pharmacy viability.

models.name: AI-Supercharged Mortgage Brokerage
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native mortgage brokerage. AI handles: rate shopping across 100+ lenders, document collection/verification, underwriting pre-qualification, compliance checking (TRID, HMDA). Broker focuses on complex cases and relationships. 1 broker + AI handles volume of 5-person traditional shop. Rate environment volatility creating need for faster, more responsive brokers.

models.name: AI-Native Professional Staffing Agency
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: As traditional staffing declines (-7.6% employment), AI-native staffing firms gain share. AI handles: candidate screening, skills assessment, matching, interview scheduling, onboarding. Recruiter focuses on relationship management and complex placements. 1 recruiter + AI fills roles at rate of 5-person traditional team. Price at 10-12% fee vs traditional 20-25%.

key_new_sectors: 811111 Auto Repair (390K emp, 86K estabs) — Silver Tsunami + AI diagnostics
561730 Landscaping (879K emp, 122K estabs) — MOST fragmented service sector
624120 Elder Care (2.23M emp, 925K estabs) — MOST fragmented overall + demographic demand
425120 Wholesale Brokers (512K emp, 122K estabs) — HIGH Baumol middleman disruption
531311/2 Property Management (698K emp, 98K estabs) — fragmented + Fair Housing compliance moat
622110 Hospitals (4.9M emp) — operations AI for $394B total wages
541330 Engineering (1.14M emp) — infrastructure bill demand surge
512110 Motion Picture (206K emp, declining) — dead business revival
811310 Commercial Equipment Repair (236K emp) — data center cooling demand
